body: Hey guys I have a YouTube channel and I use Fraps to record and movie maker to edit. Although I'm getting tired of movie maker, is there any free editing software with no watermark? No I don't want to go straight away by torrenting or illegally downloading, unless its that good lol. Also if you know a better recording software please tell me! I'm fine with fraps, but sometimes I like to try out new things :)
body_tagged: Hey guys I have a YouTube channel and I use Fraps to record and movie maker to edit. Although I'm getting tired of movie maker, is there any free editing software with no watermark? No I don't want to go straight away by torrenting or illegally downloading, unless its that good lol. Also if you know a better recording software please tell me! I'm fine with fraps, but sometimes I like to try out new things :)
title: YouTube help?

replies.body:
Hey, I use Sony Vegas to edit but I think you could use that but I think for you I would commend to you Camtasia Studio and use the Camtasia Editor. Myself for a few scenes in my YouTube videos I am forced to use Camtasia Editor because of what I wanted todo then I would use Sony Vegas.

You can easily Google 'How to get cracked version of _______' either Camtasia or Sony Vegas. Try them out and come back and ask me if you need help.
replies.body_tagged:
Hey, I use Sony Vegas to edit but I think you could use that but I think for you I would commend to you Camtasia Studio and use the Camtasia Editor. Myself for a few scenes in my YouTube videos I am forced to use Camtasia Editor because of what I wanted todo then I would use Sony Vegas.

You can easily Google 'How to get cracked version of _______' either Camtasia or Sony Vegas. Try them out and come back and ask me if you need help.

replies.body: You can try out Camtasia Studio I suppose.. it has a 30 day free trial which you can keep renewing :P
replies.body_tagged: You can try out Camtasia Studio I suppose.. it has a 30 day free trial which you can keep renewing :P

replies.body: I don't know too much about where to find software and stuff like that but for other stuff... this video has some good starter tips.

replies.body: How would I keep renewing?
replies.body_tagged: How would I keep renewing?

reply_to.body: You can try out Camtasia Studio I suppose.. it has a 30 day free trial which you can keep renewing :P
reply_to.body_tagged: You can try out Camtasia Studio I suppose.. it has a 30 day free trial which you can keep renewing :P

replies.body:
"on your computer search regedit, then go into "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT"

Then go "Ctrl + F" and type dromjmfile, and on the right side where it says default, right click and hit delete. Then go into your camtasia trial."

-Ryiley

But yeah that's how you make it so your trial doesn't run out anymore.

-Ryiley

But yeah that's how you make it so your trial doesn't run out anymore.

replies.body:
Do you get limited uses?
No, if you crack the program as Porky showed you above it will be infinite, full version program.
Do I do this?
Yes, because I do use this somewhat but not all the time, also it would be annoying to refresh the trial every 30 days.

replies.body:
Yes xd
It may be a good way to start if you don't have a lot of money tho because all the good programs cost a lot of money.

I guess it's your choice, I was full legal with my recording software and editing software and thumbnail making (photoshop elements) were they were all paid but now I'm moving to photoshop, adobe premiere pro and after effects which cost much more if I were to pay irl.
